meanings.definition: A mineral deposit formed by the evaporation of seawater or saltwater.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the evaporite found in the ancient seabed.
meanings.sent2: The evaporite crystals shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The evaporite seemed to sparkle like tiny diamonds.
meanings.sent4: The evaporite was like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The children marveled at the beauty of the evaporite formations.

meanings.definition: A sedimentary rock composed of minerals that precipitate from evaporating water.
meanings.sent1: The geologist identified the evaporite as a type of sedimentary rock.
meanings.sent2: The layers of evaporite showed the passage of time.
meanings.sent3: The evaporite rock looked like a colorful layer cake.
meanings.sent4: The evaporite resembled a frozen moment in geological history.
meanings.sent5: The evaporite layers told a story of ancient environments.

meanings.definition: To form or deposit as an evaporite.
meanings.sent1: The saltwater will evaporite, leaving behind mineral deposits.
meanings.sent2: She watched the water evaporite slowly in the heat.
meanings.sent3: The puddle seemed to evaporite before their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The memories evaporite like mist in the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: His hopes began to evaporite as reality set in.
